name: 72% Cacao Dark Chocolate Nut Butter Cups
description: There are few treats more decadent than rich and creamy chocolate nut butter cups. Instead of reaching for the store-bought kind, it's simple to make these delicious delights at home, using Ghirardelli® 72% Cacao Dark Chocolate Chips.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup Ghirardelli 72% Cacao Dark Chocolate Chips, divided
⅓ cup creamy natural peanut butter
Pinch of salt, plus extra for topping

recipeInstructions.text: Line a muffin tin with paper liners.
In a medium microwave safe bowl, melt 3/4 cup of Ghirardelli 72% Cacao Dark Chocolate Chips, by heating in microwave at 30 second increments and stirring in between, until completely melted.
Add remaining 1/4 cup of Ghirardelli 72% Cacao Dark Chocolate Chips to melted chocolate and stir. Set this aside to cool slightly while preparing the filling.
In a small bowl, mix together peanut butter, vanilla extract, salt, and powdered sugar or sweetener of choice. Set aside.
If the Ghirardelli 72% Cacao Dark Chocolate Chips haven't fully melted, return to microwave and heat in 5 second increments, stirring in between, until smooth. Be careful not to overheat.

Spoon about 2 teaspoons' worth of melted chocolate into the bottom of the paper liner. Gently tilt and swirl chocolate to coat the bottom and 3/4 inch up the sides of the paper liner. Repeat with remaining paper liners and place in fridge until chocolate is set, about 5 minutes.
Add about 2 teaspoons of peanut butter filling into the cavity of each chocolate cup, spread to form an even layer.

Add another 2 teaspoons of chocolate on top of peanut butter and tap gently to spread chocolate over peanut butter. Sprinkle with sea salt and return to fridge for 10 to 15 minutes until chocolate is set.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: 72% Cacao Dark Chocolate Nut Butter Cups

review.reviewBody: Well done! These were easy and turned out great! I wouldn’t change a thing. They were a huge hit!
Wow! These taste like adult versions of the Tagalong Girl Scout cookie. Delicious and so easy to make!
We made these with the kids and they were good!  They were easy to make and they are great for dark chocolate lovers!  I had to double the recipe to make 12.

What's not to love about dark chocolate and peanut butter? These were a definite winner in our house. I swapped the peanut butter for powdered peanut butter to cut the fat and switched the powdered sugar for stevia to decrease the sugar. The recipe was easy to whip up. This would be great for the holidays or for your valentine on the special day.

These turned out way better than I thought they would. They did not last more than an hour in my house. 

The recipe was easy to follow and requires no baking at all. I did make some changes to the posted recipe. I used pink seas salt vs the standard table salt both in the recipe and also to top the cups. I prefer the taste of it and I like a bit of savory with my sweet. The salt plus the dark chocolate were a wonderful combination. I also used Almond butter vs Peanut Butter. Either will work that is just what I had available at the time.

As you can see from my picture I did not use cupcake liners. My wife had just recently bought silicone molds for another recipe and I wanted to try them out. It was a bit messy but it worked. If you are going to go this route place a little chocolate on the bottom of the mold, place a dollop of nut butter in the mold, then cover with more chocolate. Trying to paint the sides was ... well ... messy to say the least.

I have since made these again and added chopped almonds to the nut butter for a bit more texture. I highly recommend these.
These were fantastic! The dark chocolate is wonderful with peanut butter - which is what we used. And a little sprinkling of flaky sea salt to finish them was just perf.
great chocolate candy. makes great gifts for Christmas!
This recipe was a hit at my house for vegans (me) and non-vegans (the rest of my family) alike. They were super easy to make, easily customizable, and delicious!
